Tappan ZEExpress Service Interruption this Saturday, October 29th in Tarrytown

Today, Sat. October 29th, the Village of Tarrytown will be hosting a Halloween Parade that will result in street closures that will prevent TZx bus service to Tarrytown Train Station between 4:00 PM and 7:00 PM. This includes TZx Eastbound stops at 5:37 PM & 6:32 PM and TZx Westbound stops at 4:46 PM & 5:43 PM. As an alternative, TZx and Metro-North Harlem Line connections can be made at White Plains. The TZx departs from "Lane E" at the White Plains Transcenter, located across the street from the train station.

N Line - Weeknight and Weekend Planned Service Changes

To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.

Pascack Valley Line: Busing due to Grade Crossing Repairs Weekends Oct. 22 - Nov. 5 & Midday

Buses will replace train service on the Pascack Valley Line to accommodate grade crossing repairs and maintenance work weekends from October 8 to November 5 and midday weekdays from October 10 to November 4. Weekends of October 22-23 and 29-30 No trains operate. Local and New York State buses operate between Spring Valley and Secaucus. Weekday midday hours from Monday, October 10 - November 4 Buses will operate between Spring Valley and New Bridge Landing during midday hours only. See full details at http://bit.ly/2e6uYpE

Full Rail Service Resumes into Hoboken Terminal on Monday, October 17

On Monday, October 17, NJ TRANSIT opened six more tracks at Hoboken Terminal, restoring full train service into and out of Hoboken Terminal. Customers should note that there also will be some reconfiguration of paths of travel to account for the change in access points. Customers may experience some delays as NJ TRANSIT personnel work with construction crews to continue to clear the area. See full details at http://bit.ly/2cXa0b8

Danbury Branch Weekend Substitute Busing, Fri., Oct. 14 , and Sat. & Sun., Oct. 15 & 16

Substitute Bus Service will be provided between Danbury and South Norwalk for select trains on Friday after 8 P.M., October 14, and all trains on Saturday and Sunday, October 15 and 16, 2016. The service change will support grade crossing work on Perry Ave. in Norwalk. Thank you for your patience during this infrastructure improvement. Buses will operate approximately 15 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus and train schedule here, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Danbury_Busing_101416.pdf For more information, call Customer Service 511 (in CT, 877-690-5114) or visit www.mta.info/mnr

Danbury Branch Weekend Substitute Busing, Fri., Oct. 14 , and Sat. & Sun., Oct. 15 & 16

The service change will support grade crossing work on Perry Ave. in Norwalk. Thank you for your patience during this infrastructure improvement. Buses will operate approximately 15 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus and train schedule here, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Danbury_Busing_101416.pdf For more information, call Customer Service 511 (in CT, 877-690-5114) or visit www.mta.info/mnr

Weekends of October 8-9, 15-16, 22-23 and 29-30 No trains operate. Local and New York State buses operate between Spring Valley and Secaucus. Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable.

LIRR is providing limited alternate service to/from stations between Hicksville through Ronkonkoma with a diesel shuttle train that is operating between Hicksville and Babylon. Transfer trains at Hicksville for service to/from Ronkonkoma. Westbound customers take a train from Ronkonkoma to Hicksville, then transfer to a diesel train for Babylon, which travels along the "Central Branch." At Babylon board a westbound train to Penn. Eastbound customers take a train to Babylon, then transfer to a diesel train for Hicksville, which is also traveling along the "Central Branch." At Hicksville, transfer for a train to Ronkonkoma. Avoid delays by using the Montauk or Babylon branches. Visit www.mta.info for additional information. To view a map: http://wp1.mtahq.org/lirr/alternate-service/ZtrainMap.jpg

Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable..

Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable..

Buses will operate approximately 15 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus and train schedule here, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Danbury_Busing_Layout_2.pdf
Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable..

Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable.

Wassaic Branch Substitute Busing, Fri. thru Sun., Oct. 7 thru 9

Substitute Bus Service will be provided between Southeast and Wassaic for select trains on Friday evening, October 7, and all trains on Saturday and Sunday October 8 and 9, 2016. Note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus and train schedule here, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic_bus_9_16.pdf Thank you for your patience during this service improvement.
Danbury Branch Customers Weekend Substitute Busing, Sat. & Sun., Oct. 8 & 9, 2016

Substitute Bus Service will be provided between Danbury and South Norwalk for all trains on Saturday and Sunday, October 8 and 9, 2016. The service change will support grade crossing work on Perry Ave. in Norwalk. Thank you for your patience during this infrastructure improvement. Buses will operate approximately 15 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus and train schedule here, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Danbury_Busing_Layout_2.pdf
Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable..
Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Train Service to Hoboken Resumes Mon. Oct. 10

Starting Mon. Oct. 10, Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Train Service to Hoboken returns with some schedule adjustments. See www.njtransit.com for updates. See more info at: http://bit.ly/2dAyoPc Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services.

Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable.
Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service In Effect

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows. Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Danbury Branch Customers Weekend Substitute Busing, Sat. & Sun., Oct. 8 & 9, 2016

Substitute Bus Service will be provided between Danbury and South Norwalk for all trains on Saturday and Sunday, October 8 and 9, 2016. Wassaic Branch Substitute Busing, Fri. evening thru Sun., Oct. 7 thru 9

Note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus and train schedule here, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic_bus_9_16.pdf Thank you for your patience during this service improvement.
Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable.
Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service In Effect

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows. Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. See bus and train schedule here, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Wassaic_bus_9_16.pdf Thank you for your patience during this service improvement.
Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable.
The 7:35PM train from Atlantic Terminal due Hempstead at 8:26PM is operating 10 minutes late due to late-arriving equipment.
Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service In Effect

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows. Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Hudson Line Hourly Weekend Service October 8 & 9

The final phase of a project to replace switches in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium will take place the weekend of October 8 & 9. The work at this critical location on the railroad requires two of the three main line tracks to be taken out of service. As a result, Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times on both days the project is taking place. In addition, some trains that operate between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie - and will require customers to transfer at Croton-Harmon. See train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk or check an Oct.2 timetable.

Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service In Effect

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows. Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service In Effect

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows. Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service In Effect

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows: Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

LIRR Service to National League Wild Card Game Oct. 5

On Wednesday, October 5th, Port Washington Branch trains will stop at Mets-Willets Point every 30 minutes for fans attending the National League Wild Card Game. Those traveling from eastern Long Island can reach Mets-Willets Point by transferring to Port Washington Branch trains at Woodside. Let's Go Mets!

Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service, Starting Monday, Oct. 3, 2016

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows: Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service, Starting Monday, Oct. 3, 2016

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows: Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows: Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service, Starting Monday, Oct. 3, 2016

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows: Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Technical Difficulties with our Automated Phone System

We continue to experience technical difficulties with our automated phone system. For information pertaining to schedules please call 511; CT customers please call 1-877-690-5114. Please ask for a representative who will assist you until the necessary repairs are completed to our phone system.

Our new timetables, effective Sunday, October 2, look to improve on-time performance in peak periods and accommodate critical track and other infrastructure work to ensure the safety and reliability of your commute. On the Harlem Line: Adjustments of 1 - 2 minutes were made to eleven AM-Peak and ten PM-Peak trains. Three Upper Harlem AM-Peak trains - the 6:58 AM from Southeast, the 6:51 AM from Wassaic, and the 8:08 AM from Southeast - will stop at North White Plains. On the New Haven Line: The 7:04 PM local to Grand Central will depart 3 minutes later to streamline service in the PM Peak and improve the on-time performance of several trains. Six AM-Peak trains will see their schedules adjusted by 1 - 2 minutes to better reflect actual performance. On the Waterbury Branch, timber replacement and catenary work at Devon bridge will be completed, and the temporary Devon Transfer station will close. Waterbury Branch customers will once again be able to transfer to/from trains at Bridgeport. On the Hudson Line: Switch replacement in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium takes place the weekend of October 8 - 9. Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times for that weekend. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times. Some trains between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie. Customers will transfer at Croton-Harmon. See full details at http://bit.ly/2d3RuNj . Get train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk. Timetables are available in Grand Central and outlying ticket offices. Or use our Train Time app (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ)

Alternate Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line Weekday Service, Starting Monday, Oct. 3, 2016

NJ TRANSIT rail service remains suspended in and out of Hoboken due to a train accident at Hoboken station. Alternatively customers can use NJTRANSIT train service to Secaucus. Please visit the NJTRANSIT website at www.njtransit.com for the latest schedule information. There you can also see updates on the service status of the Port Jervis Line and the Pascack Valley Line. Metro-North will continue to cross-honor West of Hudson Metro-North tickets on the Hudson & Harlem Lines and the ferry services. In addition to the train service provided by NJTRANSIT, MTA Metro-North will provide supplemental shuttle bus service for Metro-North customers that will operate during peak hours as follows: Harriman Station (to Tarrytown Station on the Hudson Line) between 3:45 A.M. and 8:30 A.M. (Inbound service) and 3:45 P.M. and 8:30 P.M. (outbound service from Grand Central Terminal) This weekday, rush-hour, peak direction only shuttle service will be limited. There will be no off-peak, weekend or reverse commute service. You can also utilize ferry options to the Hudson Line, and parking options all along the Metro-North Hudson and Harlem Lines. There are also additional bus line options traveling to East of Hudson. For full details on parking, bus and other travel options, see http://bit.ly/SeCMH3

Our new timetables, effective Sunday, October 2, look to improve on-time performance in peak periods and accommodate critical track and other infrastructure work to ensure the safety and reliability of your commute. On the Harlem Line: Adjustments of 1 - 2 minutes were made to eleven AM-Peak and ten PM-Peak trains. Three Upper Harlem AM-Peak trains - the 6:58 AM from Southeast, the 6:51 AM from Wassaic, and the 8:08 AM from Southeast - will stop at North White Plains. On the New Haven Line: The 7:04 PM local to Grand Central will depart 3 minutes later to streamline service in the PM Peak and improve the on-time performance of several trains. Six AM-Peak trains will see their schedules adjusted by 1 - 2 minutes to better reflect actual performance. On the Waterbury Branch, timber replacement and catenary work at Devon bridge will be completed, and the temporary Devon Transfer station will close. Waterbury Branch customers will once again be able to transfer to/from trains at Bridgeport. On the Hudson Line: Switch replacement in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium takes place the weekend of October 8 - 9. Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times for that weekend. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times. Some trains between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie. Customers will transfer at Croton-Harmon. See full details at http://bit.ly/2d3RuNj . Get train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk. Timetables are available in Grand Central and outlying ticket offices. Or use our Train Time app (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ)

With our October 2 schedule change and the completion of timber replacement and catenary work at Devon bridge, the temporary Devon Transfer station will close. Waterbury Branch customers will once again be able to transfer to/from trains at Bridgeport. See a new timetable for train times or visit our schedules page http://bit.ly/1arccwk.

Our new timetables, effective Sunday, October 2, look to improve on-time performance in peak periods and accommodate critical track and other infrastructure work to ensure the safety and reliability of your commute. On the Harlem Line: Adjustments of 1 - 2 minutes were made to eleven AM-Peak and ten PM-Peak trains. Three Upper Harlem AM-Peak trains - the 6:58 AM from Southeast, the 6:51 AM from Wassaic, and the 8:08 AM from Southeast - will stop at North White Plains. On the New Haven Line: The 7:04 PM local to Grand Central will depart 3 minutes later to streamline service in the PM Peak and improve the on-time performance of several trains. Six AM-Peak trains will see their schedules adjusted by 1 - 2 minutes to better reflect actual performance. On the Waterbury Branch, timber replacement and catenary work at Devon bridge will be completed, and the temporary Devon Transfer station will close. Waterbury Branch customers will once again be able to transfer to/from trains at Bridgeport. On the Hudson Line: Switch replacement in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium takes place the weekend of October 8 - 9. Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times for that weekend. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times. Some trains between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie. Customers will transfer at Croton-Harmon. See full details at http://bit.ly/2d3RuNj . Get train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk. Timetables are available in Grand Central and outlying ticket offices. Or use our Train Time app (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ)
Waterbury Branch Weekend Substitute Busing September 30 - October 2

Waterbury Branch weekend substitute busing will operate Friday, Sept. 30 through Sunday Oct. 2. This change in service is being done to accommodate track work. Buses will operate earlier than scheduled trains. See schedule/full details at http://bit.ly/2dhsq7N We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement.
Harlem Line Tremont-Melrose Substitute Busing, Sat. & Sun., Oct. 1 & 2, 2016

Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose on Saturday and Sunday, October 1 & 2. All Southbound customers at Melrose Station will be provided bus service to Tremont for connecting Train Service. We appreciate your patience while we make these infrastructure improvements. For more details, click here: http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Melrose_bus_9272016.pdf

Harlem Line Tremont-Melrose Substitute Busing, Sat. & Sun., Oct. 1 & 2, 2016

Southbound customers traveling to Melrose station will be provided with connecting bus service from Tremont to Melrose on Saturday and Sunday, October 1 & 2. All Southbound customers at Melrose Station will be provided bus service to Tremont for connecting Train Service. We appreciate your patience while we make these infrastructure improvements. For more details, click here: http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Melrose_bus_9272016.pdf

Our new timetables, effective Sunday, October 2, look to improve on-time performance in peak periods and accommodate critical track and other infrastructure work to ensure the safety and reliability of your commute. On the Harlem Line: Adjustments of 1 - 2 minutes were made to eleven AM-Peak and ten PM-Peak trains. Three Upper Harlem AM-Peak trains - the 6:58 AM from Southeast, the 6:51 AM from Wassaic, and the 8:08 AM from Southeast - will stop at North White Plains. On the New Haven Line: The 7:04 PM local to Grand Central will depart 3 minutes later to streamline service in the PM Peak and improve the on-time performance of several trains. Six AM-Peak trains will see their schedules adjusted by 1 - 2 minutes to better reflect actual performance. On the Waterbury Branch, timber replacement and catenary work at Devon bridge will be completed, and the temporary Devon Transfer station will close. Waterbury Branch customers will once again be able to transfer to/from trains at Bridgeport. On the Hudson Line: Switch replacement in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium takes place the weekend of October 8 - 9. Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times for that weekend. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times. Some trains between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie. Customers will transfer at Croton-Harmon. See full details at http://bit.ly/2d3RuNj . Get train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk. Timetables are available in Grand Central and outlying ticket offices. Or use our Train Time app (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ)

With our October 2 schedule change and the completion of timber replacement and catenary work at Devon bridge, the temporary Devon Transfer station will close. Waterbury Branch customers will once again be able to transfer to/from trains at Bridgeport. See a new timetable for train times or visit our schedules page http://bit.ly/1arccwk.

Our new timetables, effective Sunday, October 2, look to improve on-time performance in peak periods and accommodate critical track and other infrastructure work to ensure the safety and reliability of your commute. On the Harlem Line: Adjustments of 1 - 2 minutes were made to eleven AM-Peak and ten PM-Peak trains. Three Upper Harlem AM-Peak trains - the 6:58 AM from Southeast, the 6:51 AM from Wassaic, and the 8:08 AM from Southeast - will stop at North White Plains. On the New Haven Line: The 7:04 PM local to Grand Central will depart 3 minutes later to streamline service in the PM Peak and improve the on-time performance of several trains. Six AM-Peak trains will see their schedules adjusted by 1 - 2 minutes to better reflect actual performance. On the Waterbury Branch, timber replacement and catenary work at Devon bridge will be completed, and the temporary Devon Transfer station will close. Waterbury Branch customers will once again be able to transfer to/from trains at Bridgeport. On the Hudson Line: Switch replacement in the vicinity of Yankee Stadium takes place the weekend of October 8 - 9. Hudson Line service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly at most times for that weekend. A limited number of additional trains will be operated during the busiest travel times. Some trains between Grand Central Terminal and Poughkeepsie will operate in two sections - Grand Central/Croton-Harmon and Croton-Harmon/Poughkeepsie. Customers will transfer at Croton-Harmon. See full details at http://bit.ly/2d3RuNj . Get train times at http://bit.ly/1arccwk. Timetables are available in Grand Central and outlying ticket offices. Or use our Train Time app (http://bit.ly/1s3fjbQ)
